meanings.definition: Make fun of or laugh at someone in a mocking or unkind way.
meanings.sent1: Tommy razzes his little sister when she trips.
meanings.sent2: The kids often razzes each other during recess.
meanings.sent3: The friends playfully razzes each other about their favorite sports teams.
meanings.sent4: She razzes him about his funny dance moves.
meanings.sent5: The comedian razzes the audience to keep them entertained.

meanings.definition: A series of short, sharp sounds made by a musical instrument or machine.
meanings.sent1: The trumpet player's razzes filled the concert hall.
meanings.sent2: The old car engine made strange razzes as it started.
meanings.sent3: The razzes of the drum set added rhythm to the song.
meanings.sent4: The machine's razzes echoed through the factory.
meanings.sent5: The musical razzes created a lively atmosphere at the party.

meanings.definition: A raspberry or similar sound made with the lips to express contempt or derision.
meanings.sent1: She blew a loud razzes to show her disapproval.
meanings.sent2: The audience responded with razzes after the bad performance.
meanings.sent3: The child made a funny razzes to tease his friend.
meanings.sent4: The politician's statement was met with razzes from the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The comedian used a razzes to mock the silly idea.
